articles.title: Woman convinced to deposit nearly $5,000 into cryptocurrency ATM in attempted scam
articles.author: Bruce Geiselman
articles.summary: A North Olmsted resident reported an attempted fraud in which she was convinced to deposit nearly $5,000 into a Bitcoin cryptocurrency ATM. She then attempted to deposit another $8,000 before the scam unraveled. On July 7, she received a fraudulent email claiming to be from PayPal for a $400 purchase that she didn't make. She called a number listed on the email to contest the charge. The scammer transferred her call to a fraud department representative, who convinced her to withdraw $5k from her local bank branch and deposit the money into a local cryptocurrency ATM, but the ATM stopped accepting her money.
